synthesis_analysis:
**Key strengths:** Validation, micro-action breakdowns, and anchoring to existing strengths/routines consistently reduce overwhelm and build momentum. Humor and curiosity-driven questions effectively lower stakes for perfectionists.  

**Main weaknesses:** Underutilized probing of deeper "why" motivations (career/passion links) and unspoken fears (e.g., "being weird"). Over-pushing physical actions or accountability backfires with high-anxiety students.  

**Improvements:** Prioritize verbal over physical micro-skills early; explicitly tie actions to intrinsic goals ("How does this align with your values?"). Normalize discomfort preemptively ("Cringe is normal—focus on progress").  

**Priority evolution:** Strengthen "motivation anchoring" (core "why") and refine timing/pace (check time constraints sooner, avoid overloading). Test fear-exposure questions earlier ("What’s the tiniest evidence this fear is wrong?").
